Package com.rapidminer.belt.transform

Class Transformer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rapidminer.belt.transform.Transformer
  • public final class Transformer
extends java.lang.Object
    Supplies transformation methods (different kinds of apply and reduce methods) starting from the given transformationColumn. Depending on how the transformation column should be read (numeric, categorical or objects) the right method (e.g. applyNumericTo or reduceCategorical) must be selected.
    Author:
    Gisa Meier

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Transformer​(Column transformationColumn)
      Creates a new transform for transformations of the given column.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      DateTimeBuffer applyCategoricalToDateTime​(java.util.function.IntFunction<java.time.Instant> operator, Context context)
      Applies the given operator to the categorical transformation column returning the result in a new DateTimeBuffer.
      NumericBuffer applyCategoricalToInteger53Bit​(java.util.function.IntToDoubleFunction operator, Context context)
      Applies the given operator to the categorical transformation column returning the result in a new integer NumericBuffer of type Column.TypeId.INTEGER_53_BIT.

      Applies the given operator to the categorical transformation column returning the result in a new NominalBuffer of type Column.TypeId.NOMINAL.

      Applies the given operator to the categorical transformation column returning the result in a new NominalBuffer of type Column.TypeId.NOMINAL.

      Applies the given operator to the numeric-readable transformation column returning the result in a new DateTimeBuffer.
      NumericBuffer applyNumericToInteger53Bit​(java.util.function.DoubleUnaryOperator operator, Context context)

      Applies the given operator to the object-readable transformation column returning the result in a new TimeBuffer.
      Transformer callback​(java.util.function.DoubleConsumer callback)
      Specifies a progress callback function.
      int reduceCategorical​(int identity, java.util.function.IntBinaryOperator reducer, Context context)
      Performs a reduction on the category indices of the Column.Category.CATEGORICAL transformation column, using the provided identity value and an associative reduction function, and returns the reduced value.
      int reduceCategorical​(int identity, java.util.function.IntBinaryOperator reducer, java.util.function.IntBinaryOperator combiner, Context context)
      Performs a reduction on the elements of theColumn.Category.CATEGORICAL transformation column, using the provided identity, reduction and combining functions.
      <T> T reduceCategorical​(java.util.function.Supplier<T> supplier, java.util.function.ObjIntConsumer<T> reducer, java.util.function.BiConsumer<T,​T> combiner, Context context)
      Performs a mutable reduction operation on the category indices of the Column.Category.CATEGORICAL transformation column.
      double reduceNumeric​(double identity, java.util.function.DoubleBinaryOperator reducer, Context context)
      Performs a reduction on the elements of the transformation column, using the provided identity value and an associative reduction function, and returns the reduced value.
      double reduceNumeric​(double identity, java.util.function.DoubleBinaryOperator reducer, java.util.function.DoubleBinaryOperator combiner, Context context)
      Performs a reduction on the elements of the transformation column, using the provided identity, reduction and combining functions.
      <T> T reduceNumeric​(java.util.function.Supplier<T> supplier, java.util.function.ObjDoubleConsumer<T> reducer, java.util.function.BiConsumer<T,​T> combiner, Context context)
      Performs a mutable reduction operation on the elements of the transformation column.
      <T,​R>
      T      		 reduceObjects​(java.lang.Class<R> type, java.util.function.Supplier<T> supplier, java.util.function.BiConsumer<T,​R> reducer, java.util.function.BiConsumer<T,​T> combiner, Context context)
      Performs a mutable reduction operation on the type objects of the transformation column.
      Transformer workload​(Workload workload)
      Specifies the expected Workload per data point.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Transformer

        public Transformer​(Column transformationColumn)
        Creates a new transform for transformations of the given column.
        Parameters:
        transformationColumn - the column to transform to something
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the transformation column is null

    • Method Detail

      • workload

        public Transformer workload​(Workload workload)
        Specifies the expected Workload per data point.
        Parameters:
        workload - the workload
        Returns:
        this transform

      • callback

        public Transformer callback​(java.util.function.DoubleConsumer callback)
        Specifies a progress callback function. The progress is reported as single double value where zero and one indicate 0% and 100% progress respectively. The value Double.NaN is used to indicate indeterminate states.
        Parameters:
        callback - the progress callback
        Returns:
        this transform

      • applyNumericToReal

        public NumericBuffer applyNumericToReal​(java.util.function.DoubleUnaryOperator operator,
                                        Context context)
        Applies the given unary operator to the numeric-readable transformation column returning the result in a new real NumericBuffer. Depending on the input size and the specified workload per data-point, the computation might be performed in parallel.
        Parameters:
        operator - the operator to apply to each value
        context - the execution context to use
        Returns:
        a buffer containing the result of the operation
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters is null
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the transformation column is not Column.Capability.NUMERIC_READABLE

      • applyNumericToInteger53Bit

      • applyObjectToReal

        public <T> NumericBuffer applyObjectToReal​(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                                           java.util.function.ToDoubleFunction<T> operator,
                                           Context context)
        Applies the given operator to the object-readable column returning the result in a new NumericBuffer. Depending on the input size and the specified workload per data-point, the computation might be performed in parallel.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of objects in the column
        Parameters:
        type - the type of the objects in the column to work on
        operator - the operator to apply to each value
        context - the execution context to use
        Returns:
        a buffer containing the result of the operation
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters is null
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the transformation column is not Column.Capability.OBJECT_READABLE
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the objects in the transformation column cannot be read as the given type

      • applyObjectToNominal

        public <R> NominalBuffer applyObjectToNominal​(java.lang.Class<R> type,
                                              java.util.function.Function<R,​java.lang.String> operator,
                                              int maxNumberOfValues,
                                              Context context)
        Applies the given operator to the object-readable transformation column returning the result in a new NominalBuffer of type Column.TypeId.NOMINAL. The format of the target buffer is derived from given maxNumberOfValues parameter. Depending on the input size and the specified workload per data-point, the computation might be performed in parallel.
        Type Parameters:
        R - type of objects in the column
        Parameters:
        type - the type of the objects in the column to work on
        operator - the operator to apply to each value
        maxNumberOfValues - the maximal number of different values generated by the operator. Decides the format of the buffer.
        context - the execution context to use
        Returns:
        a buffer containing the result of the operation
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters is null
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the transformation column is not Column.Capability.OBJECT_READABLE
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the objects in the transformation column cannot be read as the given type or if more different values are supplied than supported by the buffer format calculated from the maxNumberOfValues

      • applyObjectToText

                                                            java.util.function.Function<R,​java.lang.String> operator,
                                                            Context context)
        Applies the given operator to the object-readable transformation column returning the result in a new ObjectBuffer of type Column.TypeId.TEXT. Depending on the input size and the specified workload per data-point, the computation might be performed in parallel.

      • applyCategoricalToNominal

        public Int32NominalBuffer applyCategoricalToNominal​(java.util.function.IntFunction<java.lang.String> operator,
                                                    Context context)
        Applies the given operator to the categorical transformation column returning the result in a new NominalBuffer of type Column.TypeId.NOMINAL. Depending on the input size and the specified workload per data-point, the computation might be performed in parallel.
        Parameters:
        operator - the operator to apply to each value
        context - the execution context to use
        Returns:
        a buffer containing the result of the operation
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters is null
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the transformation column is not Column.Category.CATEGORICAL

      • applyCategoricalToNominal

        public NominalBuffer applyCategoricalToNominal​(java.util.function.IntFunction<java.lang.String> operator,
                                               int maxNumberOfValues,
                                               Context context)
        Applies the given operator to the categorical transformation column returning the result in a new NominalBuffer of type Column.TypeId.NOMINAL. The format of the target buffer is derived from given maxNumberOfValues parameter. Depending on the input size and the specified workload per data-point, the computation might be performed in parallel.
        Parameters:
        operator - the operator to apply to each value
        maxNumberOfValues - the maximal number of different values generated by the operator. Decides the format of the buffer.
        context - the execution context to use
        Returns:
        a buffer containing the result of the operation
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters is null
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the transformation column is not Column.Category.CATEGORICAL
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if more different values are supplied than supported by the buffer format calculated from the maxNumberOfValues

      • reduceNumeric

        public double reduceNumeric​(double identity,
                            java.util.function.DoubleBinaryOperator reducer,
                            Context context)
        Performs a reduction on the elements of the transformation column, using the provided identity value and an associative reduction function, and returns the reduced value. This is equivalent to: 
        
     double result = identity;
     NumericReader reader = new NumericReader(transformationColumn);
     while (reader.hasRemaining){
         result = reducer.applyAsDouble(result, reader.read())
     }
     return result;
        but is not constrained to execute sequentially.

        The identity value must be an identity for the reducer function. This means that for all x, reducer.apply(identity, x) is equal to x. The reducer function must be an associative function.

        The reduction is executed via the context and automatically parallelized depending on the input size and the specified workload per data-point.

        Parameters:
        identity - the identity value for the reduction function
        reducer - an associative, stateless function for combining two values
        context - the execution context
        Returns:
        the result of the reduction
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if one of the arguments is null
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the transformation column is not Column.Capability.NUMERIC_READABLE
        See Also:
        DoubleStream.reduce(double, DoubleBinaryOperator)

      • reduceNumeric

        public double reduceNumeric​(double identity,
                            java.util.function.DoubleBinaryOperator reducer,
                            java.util.function.DoubleBinaryOperator combiner,
                            Context context)
        Performs a reduction on the elements of the transformation column, using the provided identity, reduction and combining functions. This is equivalent to: 
        
     double result = identity;
     NumericReader reader = new NumericReader(transformationColumn);
     while (reader.hasRemaining){
         result = reducer.applyAsDouble(result, reader.read())
     }
     return result;
        but is not constrained to execute sequentially.

        The identity value must be an identity for the combiner function. This means that for all u, combiner(identity, u) is equal to u. Additionally, the combiner function must be compatible with the accumulator function; for all u and t, the following must hold: 

        
     combiner.apply(u, reducer.apply(identity, t)) == reducer.apply(u, t)

        The reduction is executed via the context and automatically parallelized depending on the input size and the specified workload per data-point.

        Parameters:
        identity - the identity value for the combiner function
        reducer - a stateless function for incorporating an additional element into a result
        combiner - an associative, stateless function for combining two values, which must be compatible with the reducer function
        context - the execution context
        Returns:
        the result of the reduction
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if one of the arguments is null
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the transformation column is not Column.Capability.NUMERIC_READABLE
        See Also:
        Stream.reduce(Object, BiFunction, BinaryOperator)

      • reduceCategorical

        public int reduceCategorical​(int identity,
                             java.util.function.IntBinaryOperator reducer,
                             Context context)
        Performs a reduction on the category indices of the Column.Category.CATEGORICAL transformation column, using the provided identity value and an associative reduction function, and returns the reduced value. This is equivalent to: 
        
     int result = identity;
     CategoricalReader reader = new CategoricalReader(transformationColumn);
     while (reader.hasRemaining){
         result = reducer.applyAsInt(result, reader.read())
     }
     return result;
        but is not constrained to execute sequentially.

        The identity value must be an identity for the reducer function. This means that for all x, reducer.apply(identity, x) is equal to x. The reducer function must be an associative function.

        The reduction is executed via the context and automatically parallelized depending on the input size and the specified workload per data-point.

        Parameters:
        identity - the identity value for the reduction function
        reducer - an associative, stateless function for combining two values
        context - the execution context
        Returns:
        the result of the reduction
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if one of the arguments is null
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the transformation column is not Column.Category.CATEGORICAL
        See Also:
        IntStream.reduce(int, IntBinaryOperator)

      • reduceCategorical

        public int reduceCategorical​(int identity,
                             java.util.function.IntBinaryOperator reducer,
                             java.util.function.IntBinaryOperator combiner,
                             Context context)
        Performs a reduction on the elements of theColumn.Category.CATEGORICAL transformation column, using the provided identity, reduction and combining functions. This is equivalent to: 
        
     int result = identity;
     CategoricalReader reader = new CategoricalReader(transformationColumn);
     while (reader.hasRemaining){
         result = reducer.applyAsInt(result, reader.read())
     }
     return result;
        but is not constrained to execute sequentially.

        The identity value must be an identity for the combiner function. This means that for all u, combiner(identity, u) is equal to u. Additionally, the combiner function must be compatible with the accumulator function; for all u and t, the following must hold: 

        
     combiner.apply(u, reducer.apply(identity, t)) == reducer.apply(u, t)

        The reduction is executed via the context and automatically parallelized depending on the input size and the specified workload per data-point.

        Parameters:
        identity - the identity value for the combiner function
        reducer - a stateless function for incorporating an additional element into a result
        combiner - an associative, stateless function for combining two values, which must be compatible with the reducer function

      • reduceNumeric

        public <T> T reduceNumeric​(java.util.function.Supplier<T> supplier,
                           java.util.function.ObjDoubleConsumer<T> reducer,
                           java.util.function.BiConsumer<T,​T> combiner,
                           Context context)
        Performs a mutable reduction operation on the elements of the transformation column. A mutable reduction is one in which the reduced value is a mutable result container, such as an ArrayList, and elements are incorporated by updating the state of the result rather than by replacing the result. This produces a result equivalent to: 
        
     T result = supplier.get();
     NumericReader reader = new NumericReader(transformationColumn);
     while (reader.hasRemaining){
         reducer.accept(result, reader.read());
     }
     return result;
        but is not constrained to execute sequentially.

        The reduction is executed via the context and automatically parallelized depending on the input size and the specified workload per data-point.

        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the result
        Parameters:
        supplier - a function that creates a new result container. In case of a parallel execution, this function may be called multiple times and must return a new instance each time.
        reducer - a stateless function for incorporating an additional element into a result
        combiner - an associative, stateless function for combining two values, which must be compatible with the reducer function
        context - the execution context
        Returns:
        the result of the reduction
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the arguments is or the supplier returns null
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the transformation column is not Column.Capability.NUMERIC_READABLE
        See Also:
        DoubleStream.collect(Supplier, ObjDoubleConsumer, BiConsumer)

      • reduceCategorical

        public <T> T reduceCategorical​(java.util.function.Supplier<T> supplier,
                               java.util.function.ObjIntConsumer<T> reducer,
                               java.util.function.BiConsumer<T,​T> combiner,
                               Context context)
        Performs a mutable reduction operation on the category indices of the Column.Category.CATEGORICAL transformation column. A mutable reduction is one in which the reduced value is a mutable result container, such as an ArrayList, and elements are incorporated by updating the state of the result rather than by replacing the result. This produces a result equivalent to: 
        
     T result = supplier.get();
     CategoricalReader reader = new CategoricalReader(transformationColumn);
     while (reader.hasRemaining){
         reducer.accept(result, reader.read());
     }
     return result;
        but is not constrained to execute sequentially.

        The reduction is executed via the context and automatically parallelized depending on the input size and the specified workload per data-point.

        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the result
        Parameters:
        supplier - a function that creates a new result container. In case of a parallel execution, this function may be called multiple times and must return a new instance each time.
        reducer - a stateless function for incorporating an additional element into a result
        combiner - an associative, stateless function for combining two values, which must be compatible with the reducer function
        context - the execution context
        Returns:
        the result of the reduction
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the arguments is or the supplier returns null
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the transformation column is not Column.Category.CATEGORICAL
        See Also:

      • reduceObjects

        public <T,​R> T reduceObjects​(java.lang.Class<R> type,
                                   java.util.function.Supplier<T> supplier,
                                   java.util.function.BiConsumer<T,​R> reducer,
                                   java.util.function.BiConsumer<T,​T> combiner,
                                   Context context)
        Performs a mutable reduction operation on the type objects of the transformation column. The transformation column must be Column.Capability.OBJECT_READABLE with element type a subtype of the given type parameter. A mutable reduction is one in which the reduced value is a mutable result container, such as an ArrayList, and elements are incorporated by updating the state of the result rather than by replacing the result. This produces a result equivalent to: 
        
     T result = supplier.get();
     ObjectReader<R> reader = new ObjectReader(transformationColumn, type);
     while (reader.hasRemaining){
         reducer.accept(result, reader.read());
     }
     return result;
        but is not constrained to execute sequentially.

        The reduction is executed via the context and automatically parallelized depending on the input size and the specified workload per data-point.

        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the result
        R - type of objects in the column
        Parameters:
        type - the type of the objects in the column
        supplier - a function that creates a new result container. In case of a parallel execution, this function may be called multiple times and must return a new instance each time.
        reducer - a stateless function for incorporating an additional element into a result
        combiner - an associative, stateless function for combining two values, which must be compatible with the reducer function
        context - the execution context
        Returns:
        the result of the reduction
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the arguments is or the supplier returns null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if type is not a super type of the transformation column element type
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the transformation column is not Column.Capability.OBJECT_READABLE
        See Also:
        Stream.collect(Supplier, BiConsumer, BiConsumer)
